org.apache.spark.sql.parquet

Interface ParquetTest


  • public interface ParquetTest
    A helper trait that provides convenient facilities for Parquet testing.

    NOTE: Considering classes Tuple1 ... Tuple22 all extend Product, it would be more convenient to use tuples rather than special case classes when writing test cases/suites. Especially, Tuple1.apply can be used to easily wrap a single type/value.

      • withTempPath

        void withTempPath(scala.Function1<java.io.File,scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> f)
        Generates a temporary path without creating the actual file/directory, then pass it to f. If a file/directory is created there by f, it will be delete after f returns.

      • withTempDir

        void withTempDir(scala.Function1<java.io.File,scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> f)
        Creates a temporary directory, which is then passed to f and will be deleted after f returns.

                                                  scala.reflect.api.TypeTags.TypeTag<T> evidence$4)
        Writes data to a Parquet file and reads it back as a DataFrame, which is then passed to f. The Parquet file will be deleted after f returns.

      • withTempTable

        void withTempTable(String tableName,
                 scala.Function0<scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> f)
        Drops temporary table tableName after calling f.

      • withParquetTable

        <T extends scala.Product> void withParquetTable(scala.collection.Seq<T> data,
                                              String tableName,
                                              scala.Function0<scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> f,
                                              scala.reflect.ClassTag<T> evidence$5,
                                              scala.reflect.api.TypeTags.TypeTag<T> evidence$6)
        Writes data to a Parquet file, reads it back as a DataFrame and registers it as a temporary table named tableName, then call f. The temporary table together with the Parquet file will be dropped/deleted after f returns.
